net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets

Interface InetHub<T extends InetCon>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of InetCon that will be stored
    All Superinterfaces:
    Hub<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GroupClientHub, GroupNetServer, OfflineHub, TcpServer

    public interface InetHub<T extends InetCon>
extends Hub<T>
    Outlines methods useful for hubs that are used for internet connections. Since some hubs who deal with internet connections also act as servers, the shutdown() method is added to shutdown the server. The method does close and remove all connections, but is left up to the implementation if it needs to do more.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    InetCon

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the hub, closing and removing all connections.

      • isShutdown

        boolean isShutdown()
        Indicates if the hub has been shutdown.
        Returns:
        true if the hub has been shutdown

      • getLocalId

        long getLocalId()
        The returned local id should be the same as the local id's of the connections. This is not required and is left up to the implementation.
        Returns:
        the local id of the hub

      • watchEvents

        boolean watchEvents(ServerEventListener<T> e)
        The event listener will be notified when an event occurs.
        Parameters:
        e - the listener that will be notified
        Returns:
        true if the listener was successfully added.

      • unwatchEvents

        boolean unwatchEvents(ServerEventListener<T> e)
        The event listener will no long be notified of events.
        Parameters:
        e - event listener to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the listener was found and removed successfully.
